senses.de: The highest or smallest amount that is allowed or possible
senses.ex: The speed limit is 50 mph on this road.

Tips.title: Regulatory Nature
Tips.description: The term often relates to rules set by an authority like governments or institutions.
Tips.example: The baggage limit for this flight is two suitcases.

Tips.title: Implies Penalty
Tips.description: Exceeding a limit can result in penalties such as fines or consequences.
Tips.example: If you exceed the speed limit, you might get a ticket.

senses.de: A point or level that you cannot go beyond
senses.ex: There is a limit to how much one person can do.

Tips.title: Physical or Abstract
Tips.description: Limits can be tangible boundaries or intangible points of capacity or endurance.
Tips.example: She tested her limit with a marathon run.

Tips.title: Context Sensitivity
Tips.description: Depending on context, 'limit' can either be seen as a challenge to overcome or a necessary safeguard.
Tips.example: He likes to push his limits in extreme sports.

senses.de: To control or keep something within a particular range or not exceed a particular point
senses.ex: We need to limit the amount of money we spend each month.

Tips.title: Control and Moderation
Tips.description: 'Limit' as a verb suggests moderation and careful management, often for improvement or safety.
Tips.example: Limit your sun exposure to avoid sunburn.

senses.de: A control that is set on something, especially by rules or regulations
senses.ex: According to export limits, we can only send a certain quantity of goods.

Tips.title: Legal Constraints
Tips.description: In legal context, 'limit' emphasizes mandatory constraints that must be followed.

Tips.title: Policy Understanding
Tips.description: Understanding limits in a legal context is crucial for compliance with rules, regulations, and policies.
Tips.example: Her knowledge of import limits saved the company from fines.

senses.de: In mathematics, limit is the value that a function or sequence approaches as the input or index approaches some value
senses.ex: The limit of a sequence can be finite or infinite.

Tips.title: Mathematical Concept
Tips.description: In mathematics, understanding limits helps in grasping theories and solving calculus problems.
Tips.example: The function's limit as x approaches zero was undefined.

Tips.title: Abstract Calculation
Tips.description: 'Limit' in math isn't always a solid number; it can be a concept of approaching a value.
Tips.example: The sequence had a limit approaching infinity.

Barrier.wordDefinition:
A barrier is something that physically or mentally blocks our ability to do or achieve something. For example, a wall is a physical barrier that prevents us from getting to the other side.

A language barrier limits communication between people who speak different languages. A cultural barrier can limit understanding between people from different cultures.

A barrier stops us from doing something, while a limit is a line we should not cross. Barangay refers to the smallest administrative division in the Philippines, characterized by being a dominant settlement or center of population.

Border.wordDefinition:
Border refers to the physical boundary or edge of something, such as the line between two countries or the edge of a piece of paper.

Borders are typically used to identify the outermost extent of something, while limits are more commonly used to define the boundaries of what is permissible or possible.

In other words, borders are geographical or physical in nature, while limits are more abstract.

For example, you might say that the border between two countries is heavily guarded, or that the border of a page is a solid black line.

The main difference between border and limit is that borders are typically physical or geographical boundaries, while limits are more abstract and refer to maximum or minimum boundaries for something.

Bound.wordDefinition:
Bound refers to a restriction or a boundary that is set, either by a person or by a situation. For example, you might say that you are bound by the rules of a game, meaning that you have to follow them in order to play.

Bound is applicable in situations where there are rules or conditions that limit what you can do, while limit is more applicable in situations where there is a physical or numerical boundary that restricts what is possible.

Cap.wordDefinition:
The words cap and limit both refer to setting a boundary or maximum amount for something.

However, cap usually describes a fixed maximum, while limit can refer to a range of possible amounts.

For example, if a company sets a cap on the number of employees it will hire, that means it has a specific number in mind and won't hire more than that.

Cap refers to a specific maximum amount, while limit refers to a range of possible amounts up to a maximum.

Frontier.wordDefinition:
Frontier refers to a boundary that marks the farthest advance or limit of an area or field.

A frontier is generally seen as a challenge to be overcome, as there is typically a sense of adventure or danger associated with it.

A frontier is a boundary that is meant to be pushed, while a limit is a boundary that is meant to be observed.

Maximum.wordDefinition:
For example, a speed limit is the maximum speed at which a vehicle can legally travel on a road.

Maximum refers to the highest level or quantity of something. It denotes the upper limit, but there may not be any restriction on reaching it.

For example, the maximum weight limit for luggage on an airplane is the highest amount of weight that can be carried, but if a passenger's luggage is below this weight, they can still bring it on board.

In simpler terms, limit is used to indicate a restriction or a boundary that cannot be exceeded, while maximum refers to the highest or largest amount that is allowed or achievable.

Restriction.wordDefinition:
Both limit and restriction imply the idea of something being restricted or held back in some way.

However, the main difference between the two is that a limit is usually set by an external force or a particular circumstance, whereas a restriction is typically imposed by a set of rules or regulations.

Limits can often be flexible and may depend on a variety of factors, such as time or resources, while restrictions are usually clear-cut and more rigid.

A restriction would be a rule that prohibits smoking in certain public places like restaurants or parks, which is a clear and specific guideline written in the law.

Restrictions is about following rules set by the authority, which may also limit us but for a different reason.

Threshold.wordDefinition:
Threshold refers to a point at which something starts or changes. For example, in medicine, a threshold may refer to the level of a drug in the bloodstream that causes a certain effect.

In finance, a threshold may refer to a level of income below which a person is eligible for government assistance.

In simpler terms, limit is the maximum or minimum boundary that something can reach, while a threshold is the point at which something starts to happen.

quotes.Text: There are a lot of things you can do in space, and space essentially is unlimited resources. We are climbing over ourselves here looking for the next source of energy. The universe has an unlimited source of energy.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Neil deGrasse Tyson

quotes.Text: If you do things to the limit, and don't purposely go over that limit, then I think it's fine to do whatever you want. So long as you enjoy it. That's what's important.
quotes.Title: German Celebrity
quotes.Name: Michael Schumacher

quotes.Text: Government exists to protect us from each other. Where government has gone beyond its limits is in deciding to protect us from ourselves.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Ronald Reagan

quotes.Text: The level of our success is limited only by our imagination and no act of kindness, however small, is ever wasted.
quotes.Title: Greek Author
quotes.Name: Aesop

quotes.Text: The only limits to the possibilities in your life tomorrow are the buts you use today.
quotes.Title: American Speaker
quotes.Name: Les Brown

quotes.Text: I spent my whole life playing sports and training and pushing myself to the limits.
quotes.Title: American Tennis Player
quotes.Name: Venus Williams

quotes.Text: Every man takes the limits of his own field of vision for the limits of the world.
quotes.Title: German Philosopher
quotes.Name: Arthur Schopenhauer

quotes.Text: The extreme limit of wisdom, that's what the public calls madness.
quotes.Title: French Director
quotes.Name: Jean Cocteau

quotes.Text: As we advance in life we learn the limits of our abilities.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Henry Ford

quotes.Text: I don't have any limits in my life.
quotes.Title: American Celebrity
quotes.Name: Kim Zolciak-Biermann
